description.narrative:
Mothers <(>&<)> Marginalized Advocacy Center (MAMA Center) Project Summary:
EMPOWER Project is a target led project where the target groups which include aged and female headed indigenous women of the Igbo ethnic group, who are facing exploitation, abuse and violence, approached MAMA Center to seek for technical know-how and linkage to the government in order to attain economic independence.This target group is the first of their kind with request to be trained/groomed with advocacy and mobilization skillsto engage issues concerning their rights in their community.
The mainaim of the Project is to empower women of Ngwo with knowledge, to recognise their rights, get organised, learn how to coordinate ideas to be able to demand from the government of Enugu state social amenities that can empower women. As explained by the women, there have been many interventions on women empowerment levelled at teaching women how to sew clothes, string beads, make soups, etc. but these interventions are never sustainableas they are not only hijacked by young people in the community but arealso not the economic mainstay of the Ngwo women. The main concern of the Ngwo women is to be armed with the necessary tool to improve existing business- palmoil processing.
The EMPOWER Project is an opportunistic intervention in the sense that quite unlike other projects where beneficiaries are approached with interventions, this particular Project is designed by the beneficiaries who requested this intervention. it is aimed at opening up the space for women to understand their full potentials and apply them towards improving their livelihood and socio-political status in the long run. This Project will not only empower the women on how to acquire social amenities from their government but also lay the foundation for women to evolve beyond cultural inhibitions. 30 women from this community with a lead speaker approached MAMA Centre for this intervention, although the main target is up to 100 women benefiting from the Project. Thisisa pilot stage and will be cascaded to reach more women.
EMPOWER Projectwill work with women of similar interests in agriculture with specific focus on palm oil production. It will further proceed with stakeholder mapping, levelled at identifying relevant stakeholders, key influencers within the state that can influencepolicies and bring about desired change. There will be an advocacy/campaign strategy that will be developed to be used as a tool for training the women. The women will then be trained onseveral ways to organize themselves, mobilize, coordinate and advocate to those in authorityto facilitate provision of mechanized equipment used in extracting palm-oil. The normal practise is harvested palm-fruits are crudely processed through the verytedious process of matching with feet or pounding with mortar and pestle to extract oil. This tedious process of course hinders massive production of palm-oil which will in-turn enrich these women.
The Project is not seeking to supplythe women with an equipment for processing/extracting palm oil but wants to teach themhow to get their elected and appointed legislators and executives to provide the equipment. In effect, the EMPOWER Project will equip the women with skills and capacity, linkingthemupwithmembers of the executive and legislative arms

participating-org.narrative:
The Mothers And Marginalized Advocacy (MAMA) Centre was established and registered with the Nigeria Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) on 5th November 2014 with the registration number CAC/IT/NO73269 as a Non-Governmental, non-profit making, non-partisanorganisation with primary mandate to engage government on legislative and policy advocacy to eliminate threats to socio-economic and political status of the marginalised groups and advance their socio-economic and political rights towards self-determination, self-relianceand self-sustenance in Nigeria.
MAMA Centre works to ensure empowerment and autonomy of women and the improvement of their political, socio-economic and health status and self-sufficiency towards achieving inclusive and sustainable development. Through its engagement strategies#advocacy, capacity building, research and networking, the organization works to ensure full participation and partnership of women and men in productive and reproductive life, including shared responsibilities for the care and nurturing of children and maintenance of the household.
The organization works to alleviate threat to women#s lives, health and well-being as a result of being overburdened with work and of their lack of power and influence. It empowers women to receive formal education in showcasing their knowledge, abilities and coping mechanisms to attain healthy and fulfilling lives. Through regular field-based research and fact-findings, MAMA Centre creates socio-economic empowerment platform that enables women to innovatively improve on the existing income generating activities, save more money, develop financial literacy, and diversify in other income-generating activities.
In addition to increasing women#s access to financial services, the organization priorities skills learning and capacity building, self-esteem, increasing access to information and resources, and promoting collective action among women in community associations.
Vision #A world where women are involved in decisions making for sustained development# Mission #Women and marginalized groups participate in governance and economic resources are distributed equitably#. Motto #Giving voice to marginalised#
Board of Trustees; Ms. Princess Hammon-obels Ufuoma # princess.hammonobels@gmail.com 08126541004
Mrs. Chiamaka Nnadika # amakanndika@gmail.com 08032491401
Mr. Nwagwu Ezenwa - samezzy@gmail.com 08033155229
